channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration.

item.title: Report X-2023090498
item.description:
Report X-2023090498

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-03T15:13:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-02
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was recovered from the B Wing and placed in a lined tote. DescribePack: Four of the twenty-three cans of Rustoleum in fluorescent pink lost their spray caps which allowed for a leak to occur. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed in the Hazmat cage on the All-Other Materials Pallet.

item.title: Report X-2023090430
item.description:
Report X-2023090430

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-03T15:13:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-07
  • City: OCALA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found wet. Upon inspection found 1 5-gallon jerrican of Quartz Fully Body Protectant infused with Graphene Oxide was leaking out of a defective lid. The lid was secured but was still leaking out of it. Content display flammable liquid & corrosive diamond but outer packaging doesn't have any hazmat markings. Package was shipped as normal package. DescribePack: Jerrican was leaking due to defective lid. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed in hazmat bag lined tote.

item.title: Report X-2023090429
item.description:
Report X-2023090429

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-03T15:13:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-08
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Leaking package discovered during sortation. Package placed in lined hazmat tote and sent to QA. DescribePack: Metal aerosol cans in corrugated carton without dividers. No hazard markings on exterior. One can dented and cracked at base by impact with adjacent can. Contents spilled, soiling other cans and damaging carton. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package placed in lined hazmat tote and sent to QA.

item.title: Report E-2023100034
item.description:
Report E-2023100034

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-03T15:13:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-20
  • City: ANTIOCH
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On September 20, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN1210 was crushed during transit and released approximately three (3) gallons of product to the trailer interior and adjacent freight. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. R+L terminal personnel deployed granular absorbents prior to HES' arrival. HES personnel swept in the previously deployed granular absorbents with hand tools. Crews wiped down the impacted trailer interior, pallet, and nearby freight with absorbent pads and a degreaser. All spent absorbents, the pail of solidified product, and any cleanup debris were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum that was staged in the terminal's waste holding room.

item.title: Report E-2023100032
item.description:
Report E-2023100032

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-03T15:13:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-20
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On September 20, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN1760 was crushed in transit and released approximately 5-gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE personnel deployed granular absorbent to the trailer floor and worked them in with hand tools, utilizing a degreasing agent with absorbent wipes to collect any residual product. All UN1760 impacted material was collected and containerized in three (3) 35-gallon drums and RLC personnel took possession of the waste to be added to the facility waste stream.

item.title: Report E-2023100031
item.description:
Report E-2023100031

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-03T15:13:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-19
  • City: CORDELE
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On September 19, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1993 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately fifty (50) gallons of product to the trailer floor and parking lot. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Alpha-Omega Training and Compliance (AOTC) to remediate the impacted site. AOTC transferred the damaged drum from the trailer to an 85-gallon overpack for transport and disposal. The crew deployed granular absorbents to the impacted trailer and concrete pavement. AOTC utilized hand tools to collect the spent absorbents into one (1) 55-gallon drum for transport and disposal. AOTC staged the drums onsite to be processed via R+Ls normal waste stream.

item.title: Report E-2023100030
item.description:
Report E-2023100030

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-03T15:13:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-19
  • City: CHICAGO
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On September 19, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN1161 was crushed during transit and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. HCE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the UN1161-impacted trailer and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents and the damaged pail were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum to be staged onsite disposal by R+L.

THEY REPORTED IT TO THEIR MANAGER WHO CALLED FOR QA TO COME RETRIEVE THE PACKAGE. QA RUSHED DOWN TO THE AREA AND NOTICED THE ISSUE AND PLACED THE PACKAGE ON A CART AND BROUGHT IT BACK TO QA. UPON FURTHER INVESTIGATION, THE PACKAGE ON TOP WAS SCANNED EARLIER THIS MORNING. DescribePack: THE PACKAGE WAS CRUSHED BY A HEAVY IC PACKAGE. DurationRel: 11 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT BACK TO QA AND PLACED IN THE HAZMAT CAGE.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was loaded at the site of the contractors truck. A package handler noticed an odor and saw that the package was leaking and notified a manager. The manager notified QA and the package was put in a tub, while Oil Dri was put on the spill. The package was taken to the hazmat cage and transferred to an hazmat tub. The oil dri was swept up and put into a hazmat bag. DescribePack: There was room for four bottles and the cardboard that was put on top was insufficient to keep the bottles from shifting. One of the bottles broke in the middle and leaked out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was put into a tub and Oil Dri was applied to the spill. The Oil Dri was then swept up and put into a hazmat bag.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XSX experienced a UN1760 Sparchlor 309055 release from a 55-gallon poly drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 20-gallons of material released to an 80 x 20 area of the trailer, dock, and parking lot due to a forklift puncture. Absorbents and neutralizer were deployed and worked into the impacted areas. The impacted absorbents were collected into (3) 55-gallon poly drums. The damaged drum was placed into an 85-gallon poly overpack. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Description: On September 21, 2023, at 0840 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Chattanooga, Tennessee regarding the release of approximately (2) gallons of ORGANIC PEROXIDE TYPE F, LIQUID (UN3109, 5.2) from (1) 55-gallon plastic drum. Contractors were dispatched to clean up the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. The release was caused by a missing lid and contained to a 3 x 53 area on the trailer floor. Contractors were able to neutralize and clean the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. All waste generated from addressing this release was containerized in (1) 55-gallon DF, which was then taken offsite by the contractor for proper disposal.

He used a spill pad to clea n up what was on the ground and then worked with the customer to get the exterior of the trailer cleaned off.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: When driver went to go hook to trailer in drop lot he noticed liquid coming from trailer on the gravel lot. Driver then notified facility manager and a team was dispatcher out to facilitate the clean up. The trailer was moved to the dock to pull the container off and put on a containment pallet and absorbent was put down to prevent any spread of the material until the team could start the clean up. The response team arrived and had to remove the material from the container and put into a new one. Gravel from the lot had to be removed creating three 55 gallon drums of material. The inner liner of the bag was determined to be damaged from when it was filled causing the release. From the time it was identified to when clean up was complete was approximately 4 hours.

R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from ES Plus, LLC (ESP) to remediate the impacted surfaces. . ESP transferred the damaged drum from the trailer to an 85-gallon salvage drum. The crew deployed granular absorbents to the trailer floor and concrete parking lot. ESP utilized hand tools to collect the spent absorbents into three (3) 55-gallon drums for transport and disposal by R+L.

R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Restoration (ER) to remediate the site.   • Description: On September 26, 2023, at 1845 EST, XPO Logistics Terminal LBL experienced approximate 1 cup release of UN2796 Sulfuric Acid 1.8N (with 40mg/l Manganese Sulfate) from a 5-gallon poly pail. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct all cleanup and containment. On September 27, 2023, at 2155 ET, contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1 cup of product released to a 1 x 1 area of the trailer floor due to a puncture. Soda ash and absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted area to neutralize and clean the release. The damaged pail, impacted absorbents, and cleanup debris were containerized into a 30-gallon poly drum. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: THE REMAINING CONTENTS WERE PLACED IN A LINED SALAVAGE DRUM TO AWAIT DISPOSITION.

When I lifted the bottle with the loose cap on it up, you could see a cup of liquid was gone from the glass bottle. When I removed all of the glass bottles from the box, I lifted the package up and saw one of the bottom flaps had come open. DescribePack: one of the bottles of isopropanol had a loose cap and the others didn't. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: Bay doors, fans on and package was to the hazmat cage.

  • Description: On September 15, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of printing ink was defective and released approximately one (1) cup of product to the top of the drum and shrink wrap. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. Crews replaced the cap on the 55-gallon drum of product. LSH personnel utilized absorbents to wipe off the top of the 55-gallon drum of product. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 5-gallon bucket for transport and disposal.

  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On September 13, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of paint was crushed during transit and released approximately 20-gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE personnel deployed granular absorbent to the trailer floor and worked them in with hand tools, utilizing a degreasing agent with absorbent wipes to collect any residual product. Crews patched the three (3) damaged drums and repalletized the remaining cargo for transport. All UN1263 impacted material was collected and containerized in three (3) 35-gallon and one (1) 95-gallon overpack drum and RLC personnel took possession of the waste to be added to the facility waste stream.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UDV experienced a UN1814 Tigre release from a 52-gallon poly drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1 cup of material released to a 10 x 4 area of the trailer floor. The drum that released was shipped onto the customer by XPO prior to contractors arrival. The crew utilized vinegar solution to neutralize the impacted area. Absorbents were then deployed to collect all material and containerized into a 30-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • City: ELLENWOOD
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On September 13, 2023, one (1) 6-gallon pail of UN3265 was damaged during transit and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. The crew identified the impacted pail and secured it in one (1) 55-gallon drum. The centralized the released material and collect the impacted solids with hand tools. All absorbents, debris, and PPE were contained in a separate 55-gallon drum. Both drums were labeled and staged onsite to be disposed of by R+L.

item.title: Report X-2023090747
item.description:
Report X-2023090747

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-28T15:12:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-14
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A FULLY MARKED HAZMAT PACKAGE WAS IDENTIFIED BY AN UNLOADER IN UNLOAD C THAT APPEARED TO BE WET AND STAINDED ON THE OUTER CARTON. THE IMMEDIATE SUPERVISOR WAS NOTIFIED AND A DMP RESPONDER ARRIVED WITHIN 5 MINUTES DONNING THE PROPPER PPE. FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE AND CORRECT RESPONSE SHEET, THE RESPONDER DETERMINED THAT THERE WAS NO LEAKAGE OUTSIDE OF THE CARTON AND THE PACKAGE WAS TRANSPORTED BACK TO THE DMP. UPON FURTHER INSPECTION, RESPONDER DISCOVERED ONE OF THE INNER CONTAINERS WAS FOUND TO HAVE A CAP THAT WAS LOOSE BY A FULL TURN AND APPROXIMATELY 12 OUNCES OF LIQUID HAD ESCAPED AND LEAKED ONTO THE OUTER CARTON. THERE WAS A CORRIGATED PARTITION SEPERATING THE INNER CONTAINERS AND THE OUTER CARTON WAS A DOUBLE WALLED FIBERBOARD BOX.

  • Description: SUPERVISOR CALLED IN LEAKER TO THE DMP. DMP SENT A RESPONDER TO THE LEAKER WITH FULL PPE AND SPILL CART. RESPONDER TOOK THE LEAKER BACK TO THE DMP AREA FOR PROPER DISPOSAL.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On September 12, 2023, one (1) box of UN2031 was punctured and released approximately less-than one (<1) gallon of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Miller Environmental Group (MEG) to remediate the site. MEG deconstructed the pallet and removed one (1) damaged box from the pallet. The crew deployed a neutralizing agent to the trailer. The damaged product and spent neutralizer were placed into two (2) 55-gallon drums and the packaging debris was placed into one (1) 55-gallon drum for transport and disposal.

  • Description: THE AUDITOR NOTED A STRONG ODOR EMANATING FROM PACKAGE, AND NOTIFIED RESPONDER. THE RESPONDER TRANSPORTED THE PACKAGE TO THE DMP AREA. INSPECTING THE PACKAGE REVEALED THAT ONE OF FOUR INNER CONTAINERS HAD A LOOSE CAP, CAUSING LIQUID TO LEAK ONTO THE CARDBOARD, STAINING IT. CANNOT BE RETURNED IN A SALVAGE DRUM. ALL CONTENTS WERE DISPOSED OF THROUGH THE DMP.

item.title: Report E-2023090687
item.description:
Report E-2023090687

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-27T18:15:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-12
  • City: MATTESON
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On September 12, 2023, one (1) 275-gallon tote of UN1792 had a faulty valve and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. HCE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted dock and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 15-gallon drum. Crews transferred the material from the 330-gallon tote into a new one. HCE personnel cut up the old tote and placed the pieces into three (3) 55-gallon drums. All containers were staged onsite for future disposal.

  • Description: On September 15, 2023, at 2310 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by personnel in Friendly, West Virginia regarding the release of approximately < 1 pound of Methyl Chloride (R40) Methyl Chloride (UN1063, 2.1) from a tank car. Contractors were dispatched to clean up the release with the proper PPE. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed that the release was due to a loose valve and contained to the valve, and a poly drum that caught the drippings. Contractors were able to cleaned the valve, and tightened the valve cap. Onsite personnel instructed the contractors that they will be responsible for managing the wastes disposal.

  • City: VIRGINIA BEACH

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: EAGLE TRANSPORT CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 24, 2023, diesel and gasoline were inadvertently mixed during fuel delivery. During the pump out of the tank, the tanker was overfilled, resulting in the release of approximately 50 gallons to pavement. The fuel reached a nearby drain. HEPACO was immediately contacted, located the affected drain, and noted no fuel in the downstream inlet. HEPACO flushed the drain system with clean water and captured the resulting fuel/water mixture with a vacuum truck. Booms were placed in the inlet to capture any residual fuel. Cleanup was managed by CDG on behalf of Eagle.

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-16
  • City: MILLERSPORT

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver stopped to get fuel at the truck stop while performing a walk around when fueling he noticed a liquid coming from bottom of trailer. The driver then opened the trailer to inspect the load and found liquid on the floor of the trailer. The driver then relocated the truck to a safe location in the parking lot and call our Emergency Response Line and a team was dispatched out to clean up the release. When the team arrived they put on the appropriate PPE and proceeded with the clean up. They put down absorbent mats to collect the material and put into a salvage drum along with the damaged drum to be disposed of in accordance with regulations. The 55 gallon steel drum was determined to be damaged at the time of loading. There was damage at the bottom portion of the drum. From the discovery of the release to the final cleanup process was approximately 2-3 hours.

item.title: Report I-2023080061
item.description:
Report I-2023080061

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-02T15:12:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-10
  • City: BRADNER
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: BRAZIL TRUCKING INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Approximately 8:00 am on August 10, 2023, our driver stated that he noticed a transmission light on his dash, and he felt the trailer dragging. he then heard a loud pup while driving EB on US highway 6, thinking he blew a tire. He did not see any debris as he looked to his rear view mirror, and he stated the traffic was very heavy with no shoulder to safely pull off the road on a 2 lane road. So he proceeded to the nearest safe haven so he could inspect the problem. He approached the Fuel Mart on Hwy 6 and US 23, and pulled off of the road. As he walked to the rear of the trailer to inspect the incident, he found it to be on fire around the back axle and tires. He proceeded to get the fire extinguisher from his truck, but was unable to extinguish the fire. Another bystander had already called 911, so he disconnected his truck from the trailer. To the best of our knowledge, we believe that while he was driving, he either blew a brake chamber, or had an air leak causing the axle to drag. Which subsequently caused the tires to drag, and initiate the transmission light on his dash. Followed by the tire to blow out and getting hot enough to spark a fire burning the tires. By the time the Fire Department arrived the fire was hot enough to burn a hole through the back side wall of the aluminum trailer.

  • Description: One of the 55-gal fiber drums, containing 2-3 inner container sacks of liquid, was crimped from air moisture due to being left out in the weather at the shipper's site. Employee retrieved an overpack in order to safely move it from the back of the box truck to the loading dock. During the overpack process, the lid of the fiber drum tore off the drum, releasing the contents of one of the inner sacks of liquid. Duration of the release was 10-15 seconds. Absorbent was used to contain the spill inside the cargo box of the truck as well as any material that was seeping through the floor. Absorbent was collected and disposed of properly.

item.title: Report E-2023090714
item.description:
Report E-2023090714

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-28T15:12:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-14
  • City: POPLARVILLE
  • State: MS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: AmeriGas Propane, L.P.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 8/14/2023 no defects were noted during pre-trip. Jerry left the Centreville yard for St. Rose, LA at approx. 8:15am CST. Stopped for diesel fuel in MS and no defects were noted prior to leaving the gas station. Jerry noted that traffic was moderate with some construction zones that caused him to use his brakes more often. At approx. 1:00pm CST Jerry was passing a car in the left lane at 70 mph. and noticed smoke coming from under the rear portion of the trailer. Heard a loud bang and pulled to the right side of the road as soon as he was able. Jerry grabbed the fire extinguisher and noticed flames coming from the passenger side of the tractor below the 5th wheel - he emptied the extinguisher out and ran when unable to control. He called 911 at this time. The flames from the tractor engulfed the trailer and caused pressure relief valves to discharge propane and the propane ignited spreading to all 1344 cylinders being affected. Traffic was stopped in the Northbound lanes and first responders arrived within 10 min. and immediately secured the scene. The fire and release lasted about 30 min. to an hour while local first responders ensured the flames didn't spread. The interstate was shutdown for close to three hours and the scene was cleaned up.

THE SIGHT OF THE AEROSOL CAN AND THE BOX HAVE NO HAZARDOUS MATERIALS MARKINGS PROMPTED AN SDS SEARCH. THE LEAKER WAS SEARCHED IN EDMP AND AN SDS SEARCH RESULTED IN FINDING IT TO BE AN UNDECLARED HAZMAT. THE HMSC WAS CALLED AND THE PRODUCT PROCESSED IN EDMP.

  • City: LYNNFIELD

  • Description: THE PACKAGE WAS UNLOADED, PALED AND SORTED TO THE NORTH SORT AISLE. THEN THE PACKAGE WAS SORTED INTO THE BOXLINE. THE PRELOADER NOTICE THE WAS LEAKING. HE LEFT THE AREA, SHUT DOWN THE BOXLINE STOPPING FORWARD PROGRESS AND NOTIFIED HIS SUPERVISOR. THE SUPERVISOR THEN CALLED FOR A DESIGNATED RESPONDER. THE RESPONDER, FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE AND THE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET, PLACED THE LEAKING PACKAGE INTO A DMP LINED SPILL TUB. THE EQUIPMENT WAS DECONTAMINATED FOLLOWING THE DECONTAMINATION CHECKLIST. THE PACKAGE WAS THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP AREA FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. IT WAS THERE THE PACKAGE WAS FOUND TO BE AN UNDECLARED.

item.title: Report X-2023090756
item.description:
Report X-2023090756

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-28T15:12:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-31
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: THE PSC WAS CALLED AND A RESPONDER WAS DISPATCHED TO THE UNLOAD, DOOR 35. THE RESPONDER GOT TO THE DOOR AND A IRREG SWEEPER INFORMED THE RESPONDER THAT THE IRREG HAD AN ODOR COMING FROM IT BUT WAS UNSURE WHAT WAS WRONG WITH IT. THE RESPONDER COULD SEE THAT THE CORNER OF THE PACKAGE WAS TORN AND COULD SEE INSIDE THE PACKAGE AND COULD IDENTIFY THE INNER CONTAENTS AS "RUST-OLEUM, EPOXY SHIELD". THE RESPONDER ALSO NOTICED THE ODOR COMING FROM THE PACKAGE. WHEN MOVING THE PACKAGE THE RESPONDER COULD TELL THE PACKAGE WAS WELL OVER THE 70 POUNDS LISTED ON THE LABEL. THE WEIGHT AND ODOR MADE THE RESPONDER SUSPECT IT WAS AN UNDECLARED HAZMAT.WHEN RETURNING TO THE PSC THE RESPNDER NOTIFIED THE NIGHTSORT RMP THAT THEY POSSIBLE HAD AN UNDECLARED.THE RMP LOOKED UP THE SDS AND IN SECTION 14 OF THE SDS THE PRODUCT STATES AS THE PROPER DOT SHIPPING NAME"PAINT PRODUCTS IN LIMITED QUANTITES". THE RMP NOTIFIED HMSC TO BEGIN PROCESSING AS A POTENTIAL UNDECLARED HAZMAT.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found on van line 1 rollers. Package handler was carrying the package. Wet spot in cardboard from preexisting leak. Weight of 1 gallon jug pushed through the wet cardboard. Container landed on the floor and the cap broke off the top of the container. Package was already wet and leaking before container fell out to the floor. After reviewing damage, it was found the foil seal on the bottle was punctured. Unable to tell when this occurred but may have led to initial leakage which then caused the integrity of the box to weaken and led to the container falling out. DescribePack: Box was already wet when further damage occurred when item fell out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Management cleared the area and quality assurance contained the spill. Absorbent was used to soak up the spillage and container was placed in a red hazmat tote, lined with a plastic hazmat bag.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was damaged during pre-load, someone had put the box in a silver cage in front of QA. I saw the damage hazmat in the silver cage and took it right over to the hazmat cage where the bay doors and fans were on. Inspecting the package, I found a piece of cardboard was on top of the bottles which helped with transportation, but when I lifted it up, I saw that the seal of one of the tops was ripped and the cap was nowhere to be. I looked for the cap, but no one knows where it is. The other three jugs/bottles are fine they were not damaged, but the one without the cap to it had possibly two cups of liquid evaporated. The side of the box looked like it was wet, but it is now dry. DescribePack: Seal was ripped and cap was off of the bottle. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: Bay doors open and fans were on along with moved to a separate location.

  • City: PLATTSBURGH

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: We received a trailer from the Syracuse facility. When opened the HAZMAT was discovered on the bottom of an entire wall of the trailer under immense pressure from all the other packages on top. The package handler that was assigned to the trailer at the time had seen this event and called out that there was a leaking HAZMAT present inside the trailer. A manager then advised them to step out of the trailer and continue working elsewhere. After it was discovered the QA employee at the time went over with a HAZMAT bucket and picked it up and swiftly put the HAZMAT in a salvage drum. The proper steps were NOT followed completely. The SDS was never pulled when it was found leaking. DescribePack: When inspected later on the next day, it was discovered that a leaking cap was causing the slow leak. The weight from other packages on top of the HAZMAT caused a cap to come loose. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: Package was immediately placed in a salvage drum

item.title: Report I-2023080049
item.description:
Report I-2023080049

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-03T00:33:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-25
  • City: GREENSBURG
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LPG LOGISTICS LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 7-25-23: A driver inadvertently loaded Ammonia, Anhydrous (UN1005) into a storage tank designated for Propane (UN 1075). As part of the recovery and remediation, the storage tank offloaded into two tanker trailers (MC331 ). On 7-27-23, the pressure relief valve on one of the recovery tanker trailers released a mixture of Ammonia and Propane in to the atmosphere. The release was caused by an increase in pressure caused by an Exothermic Reaction between the two commodities. The valve reset, but an unknown quantity of product was lost. As a result, representatives from PHMSA, the Indiana Department of Environmental Management, Indiana State Police and independent response personnel developed a new and more timely recovery procedure (Liquid Flare). The remaining products were safely rendered safe and the incident was declared complete. A copy of the report from the recovery/remediation company is attached. Risk Management of East Central Indiana LLC. NOTE: The carrier responsible is LPG Logistics LLC USDOT# 3142354. LPG Logisitics is the Owner/Operator Branch of C Three Logistics LLC USDOT# 2961868. LPG Logistics is the responsible party; however, billing and information is handled by C Three Logistics.

item.title: Report I-2023080031
item.description:
Report I-2023080031

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-01T00:35:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-20
  • City: BAKER CITY
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: HERITAGE TRANSPORT, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At approximately 12:00PM on Tuesday June 20th 2023 The Savannah transport driver (Larry) noticed a leak near the landing gear from his trailer while stopped at a truck stop in Baker City, OR. He immediately place a plastic 5gl bucket underneath it to contain the drips. ~12: 15pm Savannah contacted Aaron Sanislo at Heritage Env. to notify us of the situation. ~12:30pm Aaron contacted Master Env. in Meridian ID who directed him to Steve Rich Env. in Baker City OR. ~1:OOpm Steve Rich arrived on scene reviewed the situation and decided they were incapable of handling the situation and they departed the scene. ~1 :30pm Aaron contacted Master Env. Again to see if they could respond. They said they needed to check with their team in the field and get back to us. ~2:20 Master Env. informed us the earliest they could respond was Thursday June 22nd. So we widened our search. ~ 2:47pm Mike From Heritage Env. contacted Justin Widmer@ Patriot Env. in Richland WA to see if they could respond. They could. Provided Justin with the Savannah Transport drivers (Larry) cell phone info and a brief detailed description of the situation. Please see detailed timeline report from Patriot Environmental continued on additional sheet.

All waste from this release will also be managed by terminal personnel for proper disposal.
